intro: Centaurea moesiaca, commonly known as the Moesia centaurea, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea moesiaca is often found in open areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
